title.value: Сравнение аллельных частот микросателлитных локусов белорусской и польской популяций Европейского зубра (Bison bonasus)
Comparison of allele rates in microsatellite loci of the Belarusian and Polish populations of European bison (Bison bonasus)

journal.title: Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences of Belarus. Biological Series

person.name: Mikhajlova, M.E., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology
Medvedeva, Yu.V., National Academy of Sciences (Belarus). Institute of Genetics and Cytology

abstract.value: Utilization of modern molecular-and-genetic markers, based on the use of multi-locus DNA markers, appear one of the most effective methods of evaluation of genetic variation of animal populations, for example, European bison (Bison bonasus). Microsatellites represent the most effective genetic markers due to high polymorphism, codominant heredity pattern and localization in genome. The article presents the research of two populations of European bison, living in  Bialowieza forest. The results of molecular genetic analysis of the Belarusian and Polish subpopulation of European bison using microsatellite markers are presented. The presence of unique alleles in the Belarusian population, which may indicate its hybrid origin – a mixture of Caucasian and Lowland bison lines, is revealed. However, the Belarusian population shows worst parameters of effective size and the level of inbreeding than Polish one.
